IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: See Schedule O for complete description.Hands On Atlanta tackles Atlanta's most pressing needs by igniting a passion for service and creating lifelong community volunteers. Hands on Atlanta engages volunteers in service across greater Atlanta in partnership with over 100 nonprofit and school partners.
IRS990.MissionDesc: We tackle Atlanta's most pressing needs by igniting a passion for service and creating lifelong community volunteers.
IRS990.Desc: Through Hands On Atlanta's student programs, 2,155 students in 25 schools were helped by 70 AmeriCorps members and Tutor Force Fellows who performed 64,798 hours of service. The students received intensive literacy and math tutoring, free Saturday enrichment via Hands On Atlanta's Discovery Program, weekend meals via Hands On Atlanta's Meals for Kids program, and college readiness coaching for high school students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Through Hands On Atlanta's volunteering programs, 123 nonprofit organizations and schools were helped by 16,694 volunteers who performed 76,614 hours of service. Hands on Atlanta recruited and trained these volunteers, and provided an economic impact to the community of approximately $1,891,600.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Hands on Atlanta, Inc did not have any uncertain tax position, under FIN 48(ASC 740-10), reported on their audited financial statements. HOA accounts for uncertain tax positions in accordance with accounting standards that provide guidance on when uncertain tax positions are recognized in an entity's financial statements and how the values of these positions are determined. No liability has been recorded as of July 31, 2018 due to uncertain tax positions.
Jay Cranman, President/CEO, Robert W. Ballinger, Jr. Director of Finance, and Monique Shields, COO received the bonus of $3,125, $1,000, and $2,500, respectively.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Committees do not have authority to act on the governing body.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors reviews the Form 990, for completeness and accuracy, before it is filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management requests disclosure of conflict of interests at board meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors reviews the accomplishments of the CEO/President against goals on an annual basis as well as salaried data for comparable positions. The CEO/President evaluates the performance of other executives against goals and sets compensation accordingly. The salaries of all non-CEO executives shown on the Form 990 are ratified by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents, conflict of interest policies, and financial statements are available on organization's website or upon request.
The process for auditor selection and review of audited financials has not changed from the prior year.
